alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 11:42AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Sumter County through 1230 PM CST... At 1141 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Panola to near Tamola to Nellieburg. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Livingston, York, Cuba, Gainesville, Epes, Emelle, Boyd, Panola, The University Of West Alabama, Bluffport, Coatopa, Dug Hill, Geiger, Old Mallard Airport, Warsaw, Belmont, Sumterville, Lilita, Bellamy and I 20 Welcome Center At Cuba. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for west central Alabama.
